user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_CondVarLock:
```c
int32 OS_CondVarLock(osal_id_t var_id)
{
    OS_object_token_t token;
    int32             return_code;

    /* Check Parameters */
    return_code = OS_ObjectIdGetById(OS_LOCK_MODE_NONE, OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_CONDVAR, var_id, &token);
    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        return_code = OS_CondVarLock_Impl(&token);
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_CondVarLock:
typedef int32_t   int32
...
typedef uint32 osal_id_t
...
typedef struct OS_object_token OS_object_token_t
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_CONDVAR 0x0D
...
#define OS_SUCCESS (0)
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No language extensions are present in the provided code fragment. The function uses only standard C constructs: typedefs (int32 mapped to int32_t, osal_id_t to uint32), macros for constants (OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_CONDVAR, OS_SUCCESS), standard comments, local variable declarations, and normal function calls/returns. There are no compiler-specific keywords or attributes (for example no __attribute__, __declspec, __inline__ or asm), no GCC/Clang extensions such as statement-expressions ({...}) or typeof, no inline assembly, no designated initializers, no variadic macros, no C++ features, and no other constructs typically documented as compiler extensions. The forward declaration typedef struct OS_object_token OS_object_token_t and use of integer typedefs from <stdint.h> are standard C. Therefore there are no fragments that require investigation for Rule 1.2 (use of language extensions).
